title: Clinician Decision Making
description: The physician's cognitive architecture: integrating clinical data, knowledge, and experience through dual-process reasoning toward diagnosis and treatment.

main.label: Input
main.description: Central hub receiving all incoming clinical information

processor.label: Data Processor
processor.description: Integration of knowledge, experience, and context

knowledge.label: Official Knowledge
knowledge.description: Formal medical education, textbooks, peer-reviewed literature

knowledge.label: Unofficial Knowledge
knowledge.description: Tacit knowledge from colleagues, mentors, case discussions

knowledge.label: Clinical Experience
knowledge.description: Pattern recognition from past patient encounters

hypothesis.label: Hypothesis
hypothesis.description: Working diagnostic hypothesis - the central organizing concept mediating between all three processor engines

system1.label: System I
system1.description: Fast, automatic, pattern-based reasoning. Relies on heuristics and pattern recognition from experience.

system2.label: System II
system2.description: Slow, deliberate, logical reasoning. Systematic analysis of evidence and probabilities.

reflection.label: Reflection
reflection.description: Critical evaluation and metacognition - bidirectional exchange between System I and System II

planning.label: Planning
planning.description: Action plan formulation when hypothesis is confirmed

collection.label: Collection
collection.description: Gather additional information when uncertainty remains
items: Ask staff or consult a provider
collection.loopback: Returns to Input - new data changes the input information

refinement.description: Continuous iterative loop on the side

flowDescription.overview: Information flows from Inputs through the Data Processor to form a Hypothesis. The Hypothesis mediates bidirectional exchange between three processor engines: Data Processor, System I (Intuition), and System II (Analytical). System I and II engage in Reflection (bidirectional evaluation). This cycle may iterate 2-4 times before reaching Reflection checkpoint.
flowDescription.decisionPoint: At Reflection, the hypothesis is either: (1) ACCEPTED → proceeds to Planning, (2) REJECTED → loops back to Data Processor for re-processing, or (3) UNCERTAIN → proceeds to Collection which returns new data to Input.
flowDescription.timing: Planning completion triggers a 5-second pause before the cycle restarts.
